hints_html:
Convert the powers to fractions.

More correct way to say this: Write each of \(\sqrt{x^3}\) and \(\left(x^2\right)^{1/3}\) as a power of \(\displaystyle { x }\) with a fractional exponent.
hints_latex:
Convert the powers to fractions.

More correct way to say this: Write each of $\sqrt{x^3}$ and
$\left(x^2\right)^{1/3}$ as a power of $\displaystyle { x }$ with a
fractional exponent.
hints_raw:
Convert the powers to fractions.

More correct way to say this: Write each of <math> \sqrt{x^3} </math> and <math>\left(x^2\right)^{1/3} </math> as a power of  <math> \displaystyle{ x } </math> with a fractional exponent.
question: 1 (a)
statement_html: Evaluate \(\int_0^1 \left( \sqrt{x^3} + \left(x^2\right)^{1/3}\right)\,dx.\) Simplify your answer as much as possible.
statement_latex:
Evaluate
$\int_0^1 \left( \sqrt{x^3} + \left(x^2\right)^{1/3}\right)\,dx.$
Simplify your answer as much as possible.
statement_raw: Evaluate <math> \int_0^1 \left( \sqrt{x^3} + \left(x^2\right)^{1/3}\right)\,dx. </math>  Simplify your answer as much as possible.
